summary: Email correspondence from August 10, 2019, discussing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in custody. It references an attached letter from the warden, ongoing investigations initiated by the Attorney General and FBI, and the lack of information on the cause of death and Epstein's observation status at the time.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Addressed in email correspondence regarding updates on Jeffrey Epstein's death and ongoing investigations.

events.title: Email correspondence on Epstein death updates
events.description: Email exchange discussing the death of Jeffrey Epstein, attached letter from the warden, initiation of investigations by the Attorney General and FBI, and lack of information on cause of death.

events.title: Initiation of FBI investigation into Epstein's death
events.description: Reports confirmed that an FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death has been initiated, expected to be extremely rigorous.

events.title: Attorney General initiates investigation
events.description: The Attorney General himself initiated investigations into Jeffrey Epstein's death, as indicated in a letter from the warden.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in custody, with ongoing investigations initiated by the Attorney General and FBI.
There was a lack of information provided on the apparent cause of death and Epstein's observation status at the time of death.
A letter from the warden was attached to the email, indicating the initiation of investigations.
The FBI investigation into Epstein's death was confirmed and described as expected to be 'extremely rigorous'.
